eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension provides a behavior that draws a horizontal slider that can be dragged by the users. The value range and the tick spacing can be defined with properties.
Note that this behavior can only be attached to a **Shape Painter** object.

Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A horizontal slider that can be dragged by the users.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Draw a horizontal slider that can be dragged by the users. 

The value range and the tick spacing can be defined with properties.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

events.comment: Move slider when being dragged
End sliding and update variables
Update "Value" based on the location of the thumb
Detect hover/touch/click (but only if the layer and object is visible, and the object is not already being dragged)
Detect mouse clicks near track, start dragging
Detect when the mouse is hovering over thumb
Use a more opaque halo while being dragged
Set inactive track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw half circle at end (optional)
Draw inactive track
Set active track parameters (by default, use thumb color)
Draw half circle at end (optional)
Draw active track (2 pixels bigger than property)
Prepare thumb settings
Draw Circle thumb
Draw Rectangle thumb

Make sure thumb width is not smaller than track height (to prevent track ends from showing)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension allows to use WebSocket based networking. 
You can use it to interact with a WebSocket based API, or a server for your multiplayer game.

Features:
 - Connection and disconnection from a server
 - Receiving strings from the server
 - Sending strings to the server
 - Error handling
 - Handling more than 1 event per frame

Doesn't contain:
 - Sending or receiving binary data
 - A WebSocket server
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: WebSocketClient
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A WebSocket client for fast client-server networking.

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers if the client is currently connecting to the WebSocket server.
eventsFunctions.name: IsConnecting

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers if the client is connected to a WebSocket server.
eventsFunctions.name: IsConnected

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers if the connection to a WebSocket server was closed.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Connection to a server was closed
eventsFunctions.name: IsClosed

eventsFunctions.description: Connects to a WebSocket server.
eventsFunctions.name: Connect

eventsFunctions.description: Disconnects from the current WebSocket server.
eventsFunctions.name: Disconnect

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers when the server has sent the client some data.
eventsFunctions.name: EventReceived

eventsFunctions.description: Returns the piece of data from the server that is currently being processed.
eventsFunctions.name: Data

eventsFunctions.description: Dismisses an event after processing it to allow processing the next one without waiting for the next frame.
eventsFunctions.name: FinalizeEvent

eventsFunctions.description: Sends a string to the server.
eventsFunctions.name: Send

parameters.description: The data to send to the server
parameters.name: data

eventsFunctions.description: Triggers when a WebSocket error has occurred.
eventsFunctions.name: OnError

eventsFunctions.description: Gets the last error that occurred.
eventsFunctions.name: LastError

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Arthur Pacaud (arthuro555)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Allows handling all events at once instead of one per frame. 

### Usage:
![Screenshot of the way to use the extension](https://i.imgur.com/DkYfM7W.png)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AdvancedP2PEventHandling
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Allows handling all received P2P events at once instead of one per frame. It is more complex but also potentially more performant.

eventsFunctions.description: Marks the event as handled, to go on to the next.
eventsFunctions.name: DissmissEvent
